title: Drawing, "Design for a Bowl", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, white chalk, graphite on cream tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: "COUPE;" at lower right: "J.P./36/1."
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Spherical body with inverted lip drawn in plan and elevation raised on circular base decorated around the outer edge with large spheres indicated in off-white chalk. Underdrawing in graphite of bowl in golden section.
Puiforcat collection contains archival photograph, Box 7, Folder 19, "Cups, 9000 series" # 9114.
Puiforcat Fabrication #: 9114, Coupe (someone wrote in pencil "vase") ronde pied? Boules de ?
